short_summary: The Women's Network brings employees together to further personal and professional development of women and foster inclusion.
full_summary:
================================

**Title (Titre)**
---------------

**Women's Leadership Development Forum (Forum sur le développement du leadership des femmes)**
-------------

**Reference Number (Numéro de référence)**
-----------------------------------------

*PW-22-01010571*

=====================================

**Notice Information (Informations sur l'avis)**
--------------------------------------------

This is a closed tender notice (avis d'appel d'offres fermé).

* Publication Date: 2022-10-19
* Tender Closing Date: 2022-11-03T14:00:00
* Amendment Date: 2022-10-27

=====================================

**Procurement Information (Informations sur la mise en scène de l'achat)**
----------------------------------------------------------------

This tender is for the Development and Facilitation of a Women's Leadership Development Forum.

* Procurement Category: *SRV (Services)*
* Procurement Method: Competitive - Open bidding (Concurrentielle - Invitation ouverte à soumissionner)
* Regions of Opportunity: *National Capital Region (NCR)*
* Regions of Delivery: *National Capital Region (NCR)*

=====================================

**Contract Information (Informations sur le contrat)**
------------------------------------------------

The contract is being awarded to a Contractor who will provide the services required for the Development and Facilitation of a Women's Leadership Development Forum.

* Contracting Entity: Industry Canada
* End User Entity: Industry Canada
* Contact Information: 
	+ Name: Opie, Davis
	+ Email: davis.opie@ised-isde.gc.ca
	+ Phone: 613-324-9165

=====================================

**Tender Description**
----------------------

The Innovation, Science and Economic Development (ISED) Canada's Women's Network is seeking a Contractor to provide the services required for the Development and Facilitation of a Women's Leadership Development Forum. The Contractor will work with a cohort of participants to share and learn from mutual experiences, challenge participants to establish and strive to meet professional goals, and encourage regular check-ins regarding mental health and wellbeing.

**Background**
-------------

The Women's Network has hosted a series of panels on topics related to women's leadership and has established a community standard of wellness. This Forum will build on this success and provide a space for sharing and learning from mutual experiences.

**Delivery Requirements**
------------------------

The Contractor will be required to provide the following services:

* Facilitate a Women's Leadership Development Forum
* Work with a cohort of participants to share and learn
